SENT.plain: This 71 years old women without any history of epilepsy had diabetes mellitus
She was admitted for repetitive giratory seizures in relation with non-ketotic hyperglycaemia
The EEG showed right centro-parietal paroxysmal slow activity
Symptomatology disappeared within 48 hours after insulin therapy
One month later, she presented with a left hemiplegia in relation with a right sylvian infraction
The role of focal transitory ischaemia in connection with hyperglycaemia is discussed
